title: ABIC Score for Alcoholic Hepatitis
description: Predicts survival in patients with alcoholic hepatitis at 90 days and 1 year, based on age, bilirubin, creatinine, and INR

ranges.interpretation: 90-day survival: 100%. 1-year survival: 97.1%. Excellent prognosis with appropriate conservative treatment.
90-day survival: 70%. 1-year survival: 64.3%. Consider more aggressive treatment and intensive monitoring.
90-day survival: 25%. 1-year survival: 33.6%. Reserved prognosis. Consider corticosteroid therapy, intensive care, and evaluation for liver transplant.

references: Dominguez M, Rincón D, Abraldes JG, et al. A new scoring system for prognostic stratification of patients with alcoholic hepatitis. Am J Gastroenterol. 2008;103(11):2747-56.

García-Saenz-de-Sicilia M, Duvoor C, Altamirano J, et al. A day-4 Lille model predicts response to corticosteroids and mortality in severe alcoholic hepatitis. Am J Gastroenterol. 2017;112(2):306-315.
notes: Validated for patients with acute alcoholic hepatitis
Better accuracy when used in conjunction with other scores
Not validated for patients with chronic kidney disease
